alert.note: Alert for Sheridan (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 11 at 5:21AM MDT until further notice by NWS Billings
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM MDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of north central Wyoming, including the following county, Sheridan. * WHEN...Until 900 AM MDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of Little Goose Creek, Big Goose Creek, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations was occurring due to Saturday rainfall. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 520 AM MDT, emergency management reported flooding of Little Goose Creek with water over some roads near the Creek. County Road 66 has been closed off due to water over top. Flooding was also occuring on Big Goose Creek as well as other small tributaries in the area. Water was reported over Woodland Park Road at Little Goose Bridge. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Sheridan and Big Horn. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Do not drive on or attempt to cross flooded roads, find an alternate route. Roads and driveways may be damaged or washed out in places. Please report observed flooding to local emergency officials and request they pass the information to the National Weather Service in Billings.
